<div class="section-text">

Hi! My name is Alex Smilor. I am an early-career ecologist whose interests center around how the changing climate and anthropogenic influences on the landscape affect avian and forest ecology. I currently work as a research assistant for the <a href="https://ward.nres.illinois.edu/" title="Ward Lab of Ornithology">Ward Lab of Ornithology</a> at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. In this role, I help maintain and upgrade the Illinois MOTUS Network by constructing new, high-gain antennas, repairing existing receivers, and establishing new towers. Additionally, I work with multiple datasets to contribute to ongoing research projects focused on the migratory behavior of two rail species and phenologic plasticity in migratory birds. Lastly, I assist with passerine banding efforts and hand-tracking radio-tagged owls.

Though my current work focuses on bird migration and behavior, I have experience with multiple field research methods and fields. I graduated in May 2025 from Colorado State University with a Bachelor of Science in Ecosystem Science and Sustainability, a degree that focused on nutrient cycles, climate change, and the sociopolitical context of building a more sustainable world. While pursuing my undergraduate degree, I spent two summers working with <a href="https://cfri.colostate.edu/" title="Colorado Forest Restoration Institute">Colorado Forest Restoration Institute</a>. During these two summers, I helped collect data that are being used to understand how birds use fire-affected landscapes two decades after a fire, how subalpine forests in southwestern Colorado are recovering following a chronic spruce beetle outbreak, and how silvicultural practices can help subalpine forests adapt to a changing climate.

Outside of work, I enjoy spending time outdoors birdwatching, hiking, camping, and doing photography. I am an avid user of citizen science platforms like iNaturalist and eBird, with thousands of observations on both. Additionally, I enjoy playing board games and tabletop roleplaying games, along with cooking, running, and swimming.

</div>
